decks.notes: The deck focuses on utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to generate continuous value and control the board. It utilizes a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain dominance. The deck also incorporates a variety of enchantments and creatures that synergize well with Yorion's flicker ability to constantly generate value and tempo advantages. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure smooth gameplay throughout the match.

The deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with small, efficient creatures and using equipment to buff them up and overwhelm the opponent. It also includes disruptive elements like Skyclave Apparition and Giant Killer to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence and pressure the opponent while also having some protection and resilience with cards like Alseid of Life's Bounty and Selfless Savior. The inclusion of snow lands allows for synergy with cards like Faceless Haven and Reidane, God of the Worthy.

This deck focuses on using mill and control elements to disrupt the opponent's plans and win through card advantage. With a mix of mill creatures like Ruin Crab and Thieves' Guild Enforcer, along with control spells like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act, the goal is to slowly chip away at the opponent's deck while maintaining board control. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value from recurring small creatures or spells. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win through attrition.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells, aiming to deal damage as efficiently as possible. Key cards like Torbran, Embercleave, and Anax, Hardened in the Forge amplify the damage output of the deck, while Frost Bite and Shatterskull Smashing provide versatile removal options. The inclusion of Snow-Covered Mountains allows for the use of Faceless Haven as a powerful creature land. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish off the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through mill and disruption, utilizing cards like Ruin Crab, Drown in the Loch, and Lullmage's Domination to hinder the opponent's strategy. The goal is to fill the opponent's graveyard while removing threats with targeted removal spells like Heartless Act and Bloodchief's Thirst. With Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion, the deck aims to maintain a steady stream of threats and disruption to outlast the opponent and secure victory.

This deck is focused on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to apply pressure from the early game onwards, utilizing creatures like Fervent Champion and Anax, Hardened in the Forge, while also using direct damage spells like Frost Bite to control the board. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Embercleave and Goldspan Dragon to close out games quickly. With a mix of efficient creatures and burn spells, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly and aggressively overwhelming the opponent with a combination of fast, efficient creatures and powerful burn spells. By playing creatures with haste and low mana costs, like Robber of the Rich and Fervent Champion, along with powerful finishers like Embercleave and Goldspan Dragon, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and end the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. With an emphasis on speed and direct damage, this deck aims to win quickly and decisively.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw effects. It aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage and maintaining board control. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value through blinking permanents for extra triggers and benefits. The deck also includes a mix of powerful planeswalkers and instant-speed threats to apply pressure while maintaining its control game plan. The mana base is designed to support the three-color combination of blue, black, and green necessary for the deck's spells and abilities.

The deck focuses on maintaining control over the game by utilizing a combination of efficient removal spells, powerful creatures, and disruptive creatures. It aims to control the board and prevent opponents from developing a strong board presence, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Goldspan Dragon and Robber of the Rich. The deck also includes ways to generate card advantage and mana advantage, allowing for consistent and powerful plays throughout the game. It seeks to outvalue opponents and secure a win through attrition and incremental advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. By utilizing creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Questing Beast, along with key cards like Embercleave and Goldspan Dragon, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge provide card advantage and additional resources to maintain pressure on the opponent. With a mana base that allows for consistent access to all colors needed, this deck is designed for fast-paced combat and decisive victories.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board by countering their spells and removal, while also generating value through card draw and powerful threats like Goldspan Dragon and Shark Typhoon. The combination of removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage allows the player to dictate the pace of the game and out-value their opponent. Additionally, the deck utilizes a snow mana base to take advantage of Frost Bite and Faceless Haven, providing additional removal and threats to maintain control of the battlefield.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and putting pressure on the opponent. By utilizing cards like Kroxa, Bonecrusher Giant, and Immersturm Predator, the deck aims to deal damage efficiently and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, cards like Village Rites and Tymaret Calls the Dead provide card advantage and graveyard synergy. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency to the deck, allowing for a more streamlined game plan. Overall, this deck aims to win the game through aggressive, fast-paced gameplay.

The deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures and stealing their creatures through effects like Claim the Firstborn. It also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by sacrificing creatures for value with cards like Woe Strider and Tymaret Calls the Dead. The companion Jegantha, the Wellspring provides additional value and flexibility. Overall, the deck aims to control the board while dealing damage to the opponent consistently, eventually overwhelming them with the sheer power of its creatures.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and hand through a combination of removal spells like Eliminate and Heartless Act, along with counterspells like Negate. Ashiok, Nightmare Muse and Mazemind Tome provide card advantage and disruption. The deck also utilizes powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Koma, Cosmos Serpent to close out the game. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as both a companion and a way to generate additional value by blinking permanents for extra ETB triggers. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal spells while generating card advantage with Yorion, Sky Nomad and Emergent Ultimatum. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by efficiently dealing with threats and setting up powerful plays with Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Alrund's Epiphany. The deck also utilizes ramp spells like Cultivate and Migration Path to reach its late-game threats quickly. The mana base is designed to support the three-color requirements of Sultai Control while also providing flexibility with pathway lands and Fabled Passage.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of small, aggressive creatures while utilizing cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Halvar, God of Battle to provide resilience and additional power to our creatures. Reidane, God of the Worthy and Speaker of the Heavens help control the opponent's board while generating additional value for our side. The deck aims to establish board presence early and maintain pressure throughout the game, eventually overwhelming the opponent with a combination of creatures and equipment.
